statement.tex: \\ \text{Which of the following shows the}\\ \text{mathematically correct way to start solving?}
\\ \text{If }g(x) = x^{\sin x},\text{ then which of the following}\\ \text{shows the correct evaluation of }g'(x)?

options.tex: \begin{align} f(x) & = x^{\sin x} + (\sin x)^{\cos x}\\ \implies \log f(x) & = \log(x^{\sin x}) + \log [(\sin x)^{\cos x}]\\ & = \sin x \cdot \log x + \cos x \cdot \log(\sin x) \\ \therefore f'(x) & = \frac{d}{dx}(\sin x \cdot \log x) + \\ & \quad \frac{d}{dx}[\cos x \cdot \log (\sin x )] \end{align}

choices.tex: x^{\sin x} \left[\, \frac {\sin x}{x}+ (\cos x) \cdot \log x \right] +\\ (\sin x)^{\cos x} \left[ \cdot \cos x -\sin x \cdot \log (\sin x) \right]
x^{\sin x} \left[\, \frac {\sin x}{x}+ (\cos x) \cdot \log x \right] +\\ (\sin x)^{\cos x} \left[ \cot x \cdot \cos x -\sin x \cdot \log (\sin x) \right]
x^{\sin x} \left[\, \frac {\sin x}{x}+ (\cos x) \cdot \log x \right] +\\ (\sin x)^{\cos x} \left[ \tan x \cdot \cos x -\sin x \cdot \log (\sin x) \right]
x^{\sin x} \left[\, \frac {\sin x}{x}- (\cos x) \cdot \log x \right] +\\ (\sin x)^{\cos x} \left[ \cot x \cdot \cos x -\sin x \cdot \log (\sin x) \right]
